THanks hazdawg for the torrent, but the explanation was very unclear, causing most people to be unable to play. Here is a CLEAR step by step instruction:
1. Unarchive the file.(just double click, and archive utility should come up)
2. Drag the "No$GBA" application inside the "Pokemon Black & White + No$GBA for MAC - HaZZa" folder into applications. (this should solve the unable to open application problem)
4. Drag the black and white nds files into "documents". (optional, but i recommend it.)
3.Open "No$GBA"
4.A "Select  Cartridge" window should come up. select "documents", then click on either game: black or white, depending on what you want to play.
5. After a few seconds, a Nintendo DS emulator should pop up, but with an error of "cant find save location blah blah blah....." with a blue background and white font.
6. click on utilities in the DS screen, top left corner.
7. Click cheats. A new window should pop up.
8. click add new.
9.Open the Read me file inside the "Pokemon Black & White + No$GBA for Mac - HaZZa" folder
10. copy all of the codes provided inside of the read me, depending on which game u choose.
11. control+v to paste inside the bigger box of the "Cheats" window. Then click on the check boxes of "RAW" and "Action Replay DS". Click ok.
12. Now click on "file", which is next to Utilities.
13. Click "Reset Cartridge"
14. Play!

Hope this helps! Took me awhile to figure out what the Read me instructions meant.

By the way, everytime u want to play again, all you need to do is select the game. the same error window should come up. THen CLick on cheats. U should see the cheat you created last time. double click the check box. click ok.
Again. u have to do this every time.

And to save, all you need to do is during the game, press enter. then at the bottom half of the emulator, there is an option called "save" should appear, along with "bag" "pokedex" blah blah blah. click on it with your mouse, and select yes.

Just to clear things up about the codes, you HAVE to put them in.  
1. open the readme and copy the codes Command + C
2. Open the App and hit your desired game file 
3. Hit Utility> Cheats> Add New
4. Paste in using a right click, Command  + V WILL NOT Work
5. File> Reset Cartridge 
6. ??????
7. Profit

As for the saving problem 
You need to save in-game and then exit the app for it to actually save. If the ROM crashes when you are in game it WILL NOT SAVE, SUCKS TO BE YOU, This is a pretty stable port though, I've seen it happen once after a LONG time so save every so often. You can get mods here http://us.codejunkies.com/search/codes/cheat_codes.aspx?selp=17&game=Pokemon-Black&gameID=17826873&page=0 


Yes they work with both versions, 
Enjoy Guys.

Thanks for the great torrent, works perfectly . For those of you wondering how to disable the sound without having the program crash to a hault, download the newest version of No$GBA.exe from the site and open it using crossover. You have to enter in the cheat the same way you did with this torrent in order to execute the ROM (you can disable it after the ROM starts). Then in the the 'Options'-> 'Emulation Setup' under 'Sound Output Mode' select None. 

 Also, if you don't want to start from scratch again, locate the No$GBA that you were originally using, right-click the icon and press 'Show Package Contents' then under 'drive_c/Program Files/NoCashGBA/Battery there will be a 'Pokemon Black/White.SAV' file there. Copy that into the 'Battery' folder of the newer No$GBA folder. Hope this helps.

So just a couple questions:

First, is it possible to have to separate games going on at the same time? As in, it's like I'm holding two GBA's instead of one. Primarily so I can trade with myself.

Second, is there a way to have multiple games going with the same game cartridge? Perhaps a save file of some sort that can be moved out of the way to create a new one, and then interchanged based on which game you want to play?

Thanks in advance.

Oh, and awesome torrent!

Sorry, typo:

...possible to have *two* separate...

Well after a little bit of exploring, I answered my own question. The second one from my above comment, actually. Follow these steps:

1. Right click the NoCashGBA app
2. Select "Show Package Contents"
3. Open "drive_c"
4. Open "Program Files"
5. Open "NoCashGBA"
6. Open "BATTERY"
7. The save file with extension .SAV will be there with the name of the game you're currently playing. You can change the name of the file or move the file out  of the folder; either way, the GBA app will ignore it, allowing you to start a new game without erasing your data.
